intro: Boehmeria rhynchophylla, commonly known as the Chinese nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes various species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. The botanical features of Boehmeria rhynchophylla make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
